author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Tiruvannamalai taluk office wore a deserted look on Thursday.— Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

Mass casual leave taken by revenue officials as part of a State-level protest paralysed several government offices, including 10 taluk offices, taluk supply offices, etc., in Tiruvannamalai district on Thursday.

Operations of several offices at the Collectorate were affected partly following the protest call given by Tamil Nadu Revenue Officers Association (TNROA). The association has put up several monetary demands among others.

TNROA functionary Parthiban told The Hindu that as many as 416 officials of the 473 in the department stayed away from office.

Starting from the rank of tahsildars, almost all employees of several offices were off from work.

Taluk offices wore a deserted look.
title: Protest paralyses govt. offices
